intro: Argyrocome gnaphalodes, commonly known as the silverleaf woollyhead, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, fluffy seeds enclosed in a spherical structure, which aid in wind dispersal. Its leaves are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and shrublands.
